availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Manville Webster (Newport, Campbell Co atty)

body.p: Newport, Kentucky, attorney. New York native. Married to Ann E. Webster. Father of M. Allis Webster, S. Nazarine Webster, F. Gertrude Webster, York Webster, Kate Webster, and Anna Webster. Attorney in Newport in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1850 and two in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 44. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 880. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 240. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 1. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 184. Find A Grave, "Francis Manville Webster (1822-1882)," Memorial #96562228, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/96562228/francis-manville-webster (accessed April 18, 2017).
